metadata.title: CVE-2022-25375 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/usb/gadget/function/rndis.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.16.10. The RNDIS USB gadget lacks validation of the size ofthe RNDIS_MSG_SET command. Attackers can obtain sensitive information fromkernel memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25375` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-lowlatency - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-aws - 4.4.0-1110.116
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.116').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~14.04.1').
